page.title: 09Camp Sites - Paignton
page.content: The Orchard Camp Site is also on the Totnes to Paignton Road. It covers some 25 acres. Approximately 5000 people use the site in any one season. A site foreman is responsible for the day to day running of the site. The main house on the site goes back to 1363 but in 1936 it was virtually derelict and was due to be totally cleared. However it was restored and became a camp site with a lot of foreign visitors using the site. There are sixty eight caravans on the site and again the family rule applies. Originally the main house was the Manor House and the horses would pull carriages down the main drive.
